channel.title: My Data Science Portfolio on Portfolio De Jon
channel.description: Recent content in My Data Science Portfolio on Portfolio De Jon

item.title: Project 1: Personality Predictor
item.description: Created a tool that predicts Meyers-Brigg Personality based on social media comments, test data had 74% accuracy. Used Support Vector Machine, Multi-Layer Perceptron, Naive Bayes for prediction. Used K-means, LDA, and KNN for topic modeling. Copy and Paste comments and our pipeline will give you a personality result, as a four letter Meyers-Brigg type. Link to Github Repository

item.title: Project 2: Los Angeles Traffic
item.description: Took 3 CSV files and merged than in Python using the Pandas package. Used multiple visualizations to explore relationships effecting traffic. The worst days to drive is on Fridays after work hours. Link to Github Repository

item.title: Project 3: Small Supply Chain and Logistics Database in SQL and Access
item.description: Created a database from scratch in Microsoft SQL Server, and transported it into Access Created queries to pull data to answers questions. Created reports in Access to answer questions. Link to Github Repository

item.title: Project 4: Video Games Sales Prediction
item.description: Explored the data to find many abnormalities and bad data collection. Used Naive Bayes, Random Forest, Linear and Logistic Regression to try and predict Sales and greater than or less than median sales grouped by platform(i.e PS2, Xbox1), also reffered as system or console. Linear Regression results : R-squared =.47 ; MAE = .6 logistic Regression results : Accuracy = .82 Link to Github Repository

item.title: Project 5: Exploring UFC Fighters
item.description: Explored some UFC data Winners vs Losers and the GOAT Mighty Mouse vs the average fighter winner Used multiple visualizations in R and ggplot2 with edits in Adobe illustrator. Major finding is Mighty Mouse outclasses his opponent on a level above the average fighter. His pace gradually increases and he dominates his fights in the 4 key categories explored(Strike, Control Time, Takedowns, Ground Control Time). Link to Github Repository

item.title: Project 6: Airline Satisfaction Exploration
item.description: Exploring Customer Satisfaction with Airline Used Map of the U.S to showcase average customer satisfaction by location. Used histograms and sub setting to exploring customer satisfaction by different variables. Used KSVM, Linear Regression, Ordinal Linear Regression to predict customer satisfaction. Major finding was the most important variables are Type of Travel, Business Travelers, Better Service the Type of Class of Travel. Link to Github Repository

item.title: Project 7: Predicting Forest Fires
item.description: Attempted to predict Forest Fires in the Montesinho Natural Park Used histograms and sub setting to exploring Forest Fires by different variables. Used SVM, Linear Regression, Decision Tree, Random Forest, Logistic Regression, Naive Bayes to predict Fires. Best model was Random Forest with 55% Accuracy and 49% False Negative. False negatives were prioritized. Predicting no fire would occur and then a fire happens would be extremely dangerous and horrible. Link to Github Repository

item.title: Project 8: Financial Analytics
item.description: This Project explores Berkshire Hathaway’s Stock performance and their stock portfolio over the last three years. The Quant Mod package was used for the data collection, and the portfolio was researched through youtube, articles, and 13k filings. RMD creates a flex dashboard. Conclusion BUY APPLE!!!! Link to Github Repository

item.title: Project 9: Job and Location Selection
item.description: Follow me on my Journey to finding where I want to apply and live through data science using both R and Python. YOUTUBE Link below. The real conclusion will be I want to be a decision scientist, live anywhere, and make enough to live comfortably. Link to Github Repository Link to Youtube Video Series
